# transitioningDelegate

**Instance Property**

The delegate object that provides transition animator, interactive controller, and custom presentation controller objects.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor weak var transitioningDelegate: (any UIViewControllerTransitioningDelegate)? { get set }
```

## Discussion

When the view controller’s [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIViewController/modalPresentationStyle] property is [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIModalPresentationStyle/custom], UIKit uses the object in this property to facilitate transitions and presentations for the view controller. The transitioning delegate object is a custom object that you provide and that conforms to the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIViewControllerTransitioningDelegate] protocol. Its job is to vend the animator objects used to animate this view controller’s view onscreen and an optional presentation controller to provide any additional chrome and animations.

## Adding a custom transition or presentation

- **transitionCoordinator**: Returns the active transition coordinator object.
- **targetViewController(forAction:sender:)**: Returns the view controller that responds to the action.
- **presentationController**: The presentation controller that’s managing the current view controller.
- **popoverPresentationController**: The nearest popover presentation controller that is managing the current view controller.
- **sheetPresentationController**: The sheet presentation controller for the view controller.
- **activePresentationController**: The presentation controller that’s managing the view controller.
- **restoresFocusAfterTransition**: A Boolean value that indicates whether an item that previously was focused should again become focused when the item’s view controller becomes visible and focusable.
- **Customizing and resizing sheets in UIKit**: Discover how to create a layered and customized sheet experience in UIKit.
